section.name: Components quickly with AndroMDA
section.p: Did you ever think: "mmm... all this J2EE stuff is too complex! There must be an easier way to program?" Read the good news: AndroMDA is here to help! Generating J2EE components (amoung others) quickly and reliably from models drawn in the graphical Unified Modeling Language is one of the primary features of AndroMDA.

AndroMDA (pronounced: andromeda) is an open source code generation framework that follows the Model Driven Architecture (MDA) paradigm. It takes model(s) from CASE-tool(s) and generates fully deployable applications and other components.

Read more about AndroMDA, using the links on the left side menu. If you start using AndroMDA, we invite you to subscribe to the project's mailing lists. Another interesting place to watch is the Code Generation Network site where you can learn about the beginnings of AndroMDA, by reading an interview with Matthias Bohlen, the founder of AndroMDA.
